meanings.definition: Tortrixes (noun): plural form of tortrix, a type of moth
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of tortrixes fluttering around the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The tortrixes were attracted to the light outside my window at night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous tortrixes played hide and seek among the leaves.
meanings.sent4: The tortrixes danced in the moonlight, their delicate wings shimmering.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the beauty of the tortrixes in the summer garden.

meanings.definition: Tortrixes (verb): third person singular present of tortrix, to twist or distort
meanings.sent1: She tortrixes the wire into intricate patterns for her jewelry.
meanings.sent2: He tortrixes his face into a funny expression to make his friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The magician tortrixes the balloon animals into unexpected shapes.
meanings.sent4: The artist tortrixes reality into dreamlike scenes on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The dancer tortrixes her body into graceful movements on stage.

meanings.definition: Tortrixes (adjective): describing something related to or resembling a tortrix
meanings.sent1: The cake had a tortrixes design with delicate icing wings.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a tortrixes charm with its whimsical decorations.
meanings.sent3: The room had a tortrixes feel with its cozy, cocoon-like atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a tortrixes elegance with its flowing, wing-like sleeves.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured a tortrixes beauty with its intricate details.
